documentation.title: WordPress Alternative Functions
documentation.standard: Use WordPress functions instead of native PHP functions to maintain compatibility and benefit from WordPress's additional security and performance improvements.

code.title: Valid: Using wp_json_encode() to encode JSON data.
Invalid: Using PHP's json_encode() to encode JSON data.

documentation.standard: WordPress provides the wp_remote_* functions for making HTTP requests. Avoid using file_get_contents() or cURL directly.

code.title: Valid: Using wp_remote_get() for HTTP requests.
Invalid: Using file_get_contents() for HTTP requests.

documentation.standard: Use WordPress's translation functions to ensure text is translatable and localized.

code.title: Valid: Using _e() or __() for translatable text.

documentation.standard: Always use WordPress functions for escaping output to prevent XSS vulnerabilities.

code.title: Valid: Using esc_html() to escape HTML output.
Invalid: Outputting user input without escaping.
